ngoList.title: Punjab Folk Art Centre
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Breif History of PFAC Punjab Folk Art Centre is an organisation which is joining the people of Punjab with their culture.The main office of the Punjab Folk Art Center is situated in Town Gurdaspur In State ofPuunjab India .Thisorganisation is working in collaboration with Nehru Yuva Kendra Sangathan Govt. of India & NZCC New Delhi for more than eight Years. It is registered with Govt. of Punjab and Govt. Of India. Punjab Folk Art Centre has successfully organised several Cultural Programmes . At present more than 2000 youths are the active members of our organization . Our insititution is traing about five hundred artists every year under various cultural trainings seminars and workshops conducted with the help of Department of Culture Govt of India . Now a Days this centre has started a well planned programme for the conservation and promotion of Rich Punjabi Culture. This programme is intitled as Cultural Enlightment Programme This centre is organising various Cultural Awareness Camp at Gross Route Level under cultural enlightenment programme.This centre is organising Cultural Programme at various occasions like Independence Day, Republic Day, State and National Levels Festivals and Games. This centre is appreciated several times by Govt. of Punjab and Nehru Yuva Sangathan Govt. of IndiaThe Artist of Punjab Folk Art Centre have participated in various State and National Level Cultural Programmes and Festivals held at different places of country like BikaneerJaipur Chamba Manali Delhi Mumbai, Banglore Goa etc.Punjab Folk Art Centre has represented India for the following International Folk lore Festivals. Year 2007 3rd Sabah International Folklore Festival Malaysia Year 2008 4th International Folklore Festival Nepal Year 2009 4th Sabah International Folklore Festival Malaysia

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Rural association for Human Interest Nurpur Bedi, Ropar is a Voluntary Association in state of Punjab. Society is working in the rural areas of two districts namely Ropar and Shaheed Bhagat Singh Nagar Nawanshahr Association is working for the upliftment of the rural peoples living in the backward villages in these areas from last 13 years. Rural association for Human Interest was established in August 1996 and it is registered under the societyâ€™s registration act XXI of 1860 vide registration no. 645 dated 12th August 1996. RAHI is also registered with the Ministry of Home Affairs of govt. of India under Foreign Contribution Regulation Act 1976 vide no. 115320015 dated 21st November 2002 Associations also registered under 12A of income tax during these thirteen years association has been putting its best efforts in bringing all around development in the society and the area which comes under the Association. From the year 1996 RAHI is working mainly with the rural communities in Nurpur Bedi block of Ropar Distt located about 80 kms north of Chandigarh city, the capital of state. There are 140 villages in this block, and the roads connecting these villages are in very worse condition. Routine development programmes of the government do not reach these villages properly, which makes the role of association more important as it aware the people about these programmes of the government. The population of the block, which has a total geographical area of 34139 hqt. is approximately one lac with a sex ratio of 1000:793 unfavorable to women.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Swami Vivekanand Medical Mission (Regd.) is working since past 40 years in the field of health conditions of the poor and weaker sections of the society. It started its first hospital in a remote locality of Islamabad, Amritsar in a single hired room at Chowk Rajputan in the year 1979. Presently, Five medical units namely Allopathic, Eyes, Dental, Physiotherapy and clinical laboratory, in a three storied building at 12- Makan (Islamabad) area of Amritsar, are attending around 200 patients daily.
